content:
Of course, I understand that not everyone is comfortable with activities that may seem a bit intimidating. Here are some fun but less intense alternatives to fit your preference:

1. Electric Boat Ride: Take a relaxing electric boat ride on the River Seine, which offers a unique and beautiful view of the city from the water.

2. Segway Tour: Sail around the city on a Segway, which offers a fun and unique way to experience the city's sights, even with some tours dedicated to thematic tours like "Gourmet Tour" and "Street Art".

3. Rooftop Bar Tour: Visit some of the cozy and unique rooftop bars of Paris, offering stunning views of the city's landmarks while enjoying delicious local cocktails.

4. Escape Game: A thrilling and interactive game-based experience, where you can solve puzzles and a mystery story in teams, allowing you to discover some hidden places and learn about French history and culture.

5. Wine & Cheese Tasting: Learn about French cuisine through an educational and delicious food and wine pairing experience.

6. Bike Tour: An enjoyable and eco-friendly way to explore the city, bike tours let you visit the city's highlights while learning about the city's history and culture.

7. Wax Museum: Paris is home to two wax museums including the Musée Grévin, where you can snap a photo with more than 200 lifelike wax figures of the world's most famous people.

These activities are still thrilling and offer unique experiences while avoiding more intense activities like hot-air balloons and flyboarding.
